result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Court reads the information.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  
Bond continued.

10:03 AM
Defendant Wojciech Chraca in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Wojciech Chraca.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Joanna Garber appears by zoom video.
ADA Cassidy calls the case and states appearances.
Interpreter is sworn in by the clerk.
Court asks Atty Kippa if the defendant is waiving the preliminary hearing.
Atty Kippa confirms.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court questions the defendant further.
Defendant still wishes to waive the preliminary hearing.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and understandingly waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued. 
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 11-28-2022 at 9:30 AM.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Invoice from Interpreter J Garber
(sent to Br 1 JA and Fiscal Clerk on 10/10/22 sp)
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: Plover Menards Store.

11:12 AM Defendant Wojciech Chraca in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Christine Bruen appears for Defendant for today's hearing. Polish Interpreter Joanna Garber appears by Zoom.

Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

11:15 AM Clerk administers Oath of Interpreter.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Defendant is willing to waive time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Atty Bruen requests matter be set for a hearing and if a waiver, then would notify the Court. 

*Clerk : Interpreter Garber would be available for the PH by Zoom on 10/28. Please confirm with interpreter.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant understands the condition.

11:28 AM Matter is adjourned.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
